modelComponent.longName: Earth System High Resolution Global Model
modelComponent.description: EarthSys brings together expertise from the global community in a concerted effort to develop coupled climate models with increased horizontal resolutions. Increasing the horizontal resolution of coupled climate models will allow us to capture climate processes and weather systems in much greater detail.

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Meteorology, University of ABC
Department of Meteorology, University of ABC
Department of Oceanography, University of GHI

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Doe, J.A.; Doe, S.B.; Doe, J.C.; 2009 EarthSys: The Earth System High Resolution Global Model - Coupled Atmosphere-Ocean model description and basic evaluation. Journal of Earth Modeling, 15 (2). 1261-1296. http://www.earthsys.org/publications

Doe, J.A.; Doe, S.B.; 2006 EarthSys: The Earth System High Resolution Global Model - Improvements in Atmosphere and Ocean modeling. Journal of Earth Modeling, 11 (3). 1021-1036. http://www.earthsys.org/publications

modelComponent.longName: Atmosphere component of the EarthSys model
modelComponent.description: The EarthSys atmosphere model has a horizontal resolution of 1.125 degrees of latitude by 1.75 degrees of longitude with 36 layers in the vertical. The atmospheric timestep period is 30 minutes.

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Meteorology, University of ABC

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Doe, J.A.; Doe, S.B.; Doe, J.C.; 2008 EarthSys: The Earth System High Resolution Global Model - Atmosphere model description . Journal of Earth Modeling, 14 (3). 1361-1396. http://www.earthsys.org/publications

modelComponent.description: The dynamical core of the EarthSys atmosphere model.

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Meteorology, University of ABC

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Doe, J.A.; Doe, S.B.; Doe, J.C.; 2006 EarthSys: The Earth System High Resolution Global Model - Atmosphere Dynamical Core model description . Journal of Earth Modeling, 12 (4). 1561-1596. http://www.earthsys.org/publications

modelComponent.description: The EarthSys ocean component uses a latitude-longitude grid with a zonal resolution of 2 degrees, and a meridional resolution of 2 degrees. It has 30 evenly spaced levels in the vertical. The timestep period is 1 hour.

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Meteorology, University of ABC

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Doe, J.A.; Doe, S.B.; Doe, J.C.; 2007 EarthSys: The Earth System High Resolution Global Model - Ocean model description . Journal of Earth Modeling, 13 (4). 1461-1496. http://www.earthsys.org/publications

modelComponent.description: The biogeochemistry component of the EarthSys ocean model.

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Climate Division, International Center for Atmospheric Research

gmd:collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Doe, J.A.; Doe, S.B.; Doe, J.C.; 2005 EarthSys: The Earth System High Resolution Global Model - Ocean Biogeochemistry model description . Journal of Earth Modeling, 11 (5). 1661-1696. http://www.earthsys.org/publications

documentRelationship.description: Horizontal resolution increased to 1.20 x 0.80 degrees; Timestep reduced from 30 minutes to 15 minutes.

simulationRun.rationale: EarthSys-ESMF simulation run in repsect to CMIP5 core experiment 1.1 ()
simulationRun.longName: EarthSys - Earth System Modeling Framework Earth System Model 1.0

input.description: Seasonal oxidant concentration in the atmosphere.
Orography/height data in meters at n320 resolution.
Global Ozone concentration monitoring in the atmosphere.
Dimethyl Sulfide emissions in the atmosphere.
Secondary organic aerosols in the ocean.
Particulate organic matter in the ocean.

platform.description: HECToR (Phase 2a) is currently an integrated system known as Rainier, which includes a scalar MPP XT4 system, a vector system known as BlackWidow, and storage systems.
